intro: Tetracera mayumbensis, commonly known as the Mayumbé tetracera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly Cameroon and the Central African Republic. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, wooded areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
